general.serviceName: Sign in to or create your GOV.UK account

phaseBanner.content: This is a new service – your feedback will help us to improve it.

cookieBanner.title: Cookies on GOV.UK account
cookieBanner.heading: Cookies on GOV.UK account
cookieBanner.paragraph1: We use some essential cookies to make this service work.
cookieBanner.paragraph2: We’d also like to use analytics cookies so we can understand how you use the service and make improvements.

cookeBannerAccept.paragraph1: You’ve accepted additional cookies. You can

cookeBannerReject.paragraph1: You’ve rejected additional cookies. You can

cookie.cookieText: GOV.UK uses cookies to make the site simpler.

content.paragraph1: If you typed the web address, check it is correct.
content.paragraph2: If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.

error500.title: There's a problem with this service
error500.header: Sorry, there's a problem with this service

content.paragraph1: You’ve been signed out because you did not use your account for 60 minutes or more.
content.paragraph2: This is to keep your account and your information secure.

mandatory.title: Create a GOV.UK account or sign in
mandatory.header: Create a GOV.UK account or sign in
mandatory.paragraph: The GOV.UK account is different to any government accounts you already have, for example your personal tax account or Government Gateway.

optional.title: Create a GOV.UK account or sign in
optional.header: Sign in or create a GOV.UK account to save your progress
optional.paragraph1: You need a GOV.UK account to save your progress.  If you don't have a GOV.UK account, you can create one.
optional.paragraph2: The GOV.UK account is different to other government accounts you already have (for example your personal tax account, or Government Gateway).

moreAbout.paragraph1: The GOV.UK account is new. In the future, you’ll be able to use it to sign in to all government services. It will take a few years for this to happen.
moreAbout.paragraph2: We’re still building the GOV.UK account and will be adding more features and services to it.
moreAbout.paragraph3: For now, you need to use different accounts to access different government services.

existingAccountRadios.createAccountHintText: You’ll need an email address and a UK mobile phone number. It will take about 2 minutes.

enterEmailCreateAccount.title: Enter your email
enterEmailCreateAccount.text: Enter your email address to create an account.

validationError.length: Email address must be 256 characters or fewer
validationError.email: Enter an email address in the correct format, like name@example.com

enterEmailExistingAccount.header: Sign in to your GOV.UK account
enterEmailExistingAccount.text: Enter your email address to sign in.

validationError.length: Email address must be 256 characters or fewer
validationError.email: Enter an email address in the correct format, like name@example.com

enterEmail.title: Sign in to or create your GOV.UK account
enterEmail.header: Sign in to or create your GOV.UK account
enterEmail.text: A GOV.UK account is separate from other government accounts (for example a personal tax account or Government Gateway).

email.label: Email address
email.text: To sign in or create an account, enter your email address

validationError.length: Email address must be 256 characters or fewer
validationError.email: Enter an email address in the correct format, like name@example.com

details.bulletPoint1: let you reuse and share your data to ensure that government services are quicker to interact with
details.bulletPoint2: suggest GOV.UK guidance and information that is relevant to you
details.bulletPoint3: tell you when content you're interested in has been updated
details.bulletPoint4: help you set up reminders for tasks you may need to complete later

whatYouNeed.summary: What you need to create a GOV.UK account
whatYouNeed.bulletPoint2: a working UK phone number with signal, so we can send you a security code

accountNotFoundMandatory.title: No GOV.UK account found
accountNotFoundMandatory.paragraph1: There is no GOV.UK account for
accountNotFoundMandatory.insetText1: The GOV.UK account is new. It’s separate from other government accounts, such as Government Gateway or your personal tax account.
accountNotFoundMandatory.paragraph2: You need to create a GOV.UK account even if you already have another type of government account.

accountNotFoundOptional.title: Account not found
accountNotFoundOptional.paragraph1: We could not find a GOV.UK account using this email address.
accountNotFoundOptional.insetText1: You may have other government accounts such as Government Gateway or your personal tax account.
accountNotFoundOptional.insetText2: The GOV.UK account is separate from these other government accounts.
accountNotFoundOptional.insetText3: You need to create a GOV.UK account, even if you have another government account.

resetPasswordCheckEmail.title: Check your email
resetPasswordCheckEmail.paragraph2: You can use the link in the email to reset your password.
resetPasswordCheckEmail.paragraph3: The link will be active for 15 minutes.

password.label: Enter a password
password.hint: It must be at least 8 characters long and must include at least one number

validationError.minLength: Your password must be at least 8 characters long and must include a number
validationError.maxLength: Your password must be less than 256 characters
validationError.alphaNumeric: Your password must be at least 8 characters long and must include a number

validationError.matches: Enter the same password in both fields

securePasswordDetails.summary: How to create a secure password
securePasswordDetails.text: A good way to create a secure and memorable password is to use 3 random words. You can use numbers, symbols and spaces.

termsOfUse.heading: Agree to our terms of use
termsOfUse.paragraph1: We will collect and save your information securely. We will not share your personal information without your consent.
termsOfUse.paragraph2: By continuing, you confirm that you agree to our privacy notice and our terms and conditions.

info.paragraph1: We will send a 6 digit security code to the number you give us.
info.paragraph2: You must use a UK mobile phone number.

validationError.international: Enter a UK mobile phone number
validationError.length: Enter a UK mobile phone number, like 07700 900000
validationError.numeric: Enter a UK mobile phone number using numbers only

accountCreated.title: You have  created your GOV.UK account
accountCreated.header: You have  created your GOV.UK account
accountCreated.subHeader: What you can do with your GOV.UK account
accountCreated.text: You need to return to GOV.UK to continue.

info.paragraph1: At the moment, you can only use your GOV.UK account to:
info.paragraph2: In the future, you’ll be able to use your GOV.UK account to sign in to all government services. It will take a few years for this to happen.
info.paragraph3: For now, you need to use different accounts for different government services.
info.listItem2: save your answers in the Brexit checker

checkYourEmail.text: We have sent an email to:

info.paragraph2: Your email might take a few minutes to arrive. If you do not get an email, check your spam folder.
info.paragraph3: The code will expire after 15 minutes.

shareInfo.title: Share information from your GOV.UK account
shareInfo.header: Share information from your GOV.UK account
shareInfo.bulletPointSectionHeader: This service needs to use your:
shareInfo.paragraph1: You added this information to your GOV.UK account when you created the account. You can choose to share it with the service instead of entering it again when you use the service.
shareInfo.paragraph2: The service will only use this information to contact you about the service. It won’t share your information with anyone else. It will keep your information for as long as it needs to or the law requires it to.
shareInfo.paragraph3: If you choose not to share information from your GOV.UK account, you may still be asked for that information as you use the service. For example if you choose not to share your email address and phone number and the service needs a way to contact you.
shareInfo.essentialHeader: Do you want to share information from your GOV.UK account?

radios.shareMy: Do you want to share information from your GOV.UK account?

radioText.agree: Share my email address and phone number
radioText.doNotAgree: Do not share my email address and phone number
radioText.errorMessage: Select if you want to share your email address and phone number or not

updatedTermsAndConds.title: GOV.UK account terms of use update
updatedTermsAndConds.header: GOV.UK account terms of use update
updatedTermsAndConds.paragraph2: By continuing you agree to our updated terms of use.

info.paragraph1: GOV.UK Sign in puts small files (known as ‘cookies’) on to your phone, tablet or computer when you use the service.
info.paragraph2: We use these cookies to make the service work.
info.paragraph3: We may also use analytics cookies to learn about how you use the service. Analytics cookies are optional.
info.paragraph4: Cookies aren’t used to identify you personally.
info.paragraph6: on the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) website.

info.paragraph1: We use essential cookies to make the service work as it should.

row1.col2: Remembers whether you chose to use the service in English or Welsh

row4.col2: To keep the service secure (security for pages that include forms)

info.paragraph1: With your permission, we use Google Analytics to help us understand how you use the service. We do this to help us improve the services for our users.
info.paragraph2: Google Analytics stores anonymised information about:
info.bulletPoint1: how you got to GOV.UK Sign in
info.bulletPoint2: the pages you visit and how long you spend on them
info.bulletPoint3: any errors you see while using GOV.UK Sign in

row1.col2: Helps us count how many people visit GOV.UK account by checking if you’ve visited before

row2.col2: Helps us count how many people visit GOV.UK account by checking if you’ve visited before

settings.header: Do you want to accept analytics cookies?

successBanner.paragraph1: Other government services may set additional cookies and, if so, will have their own cookie policy and banner.
successBanner.linkText: Go back to the page you were looking at

accessibilityStatement.title: Accessibility statement
accessibilityStatement.header: Accessibility statement for GOV.UK Sign in

content.paragraph1: This accessibility statement applies to xxxx.
content.paragraph2: This service is part of the wider GOV.UK website. There’s a separate
content.linkText: accessibility statement for the main GOV.UK website.
content.paragraph3: This service is run by the Government Digital Service (GDS).

section1.paragraph1: We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website. This means you should be able to:
section1.bulletPoint1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
section1.bulletPoint2: zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
section1.bulletPoint3: get from the start of the service to the end using just a keyboard
section1.bulletPoint4: get from the start of the service to the end using speech recognition software
section1.bulletPoint5: listen to most of the service using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
section1.paragraph2: We’ve also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.
section1.paragraph3: has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.

section2.header: What to do if you have difficulty using this service
section2.paragraph1: If you have difficulty using this service, contact xxxx.
section2.paragraph2: If you need any part of this service in a different format like large print, audio recording or braille, contact xxxxx.

section3.header: Report accessibility problems with this service
section3.paragraph1: We’re always looking to improve the accessibility of this website. If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we’re not meeting accessibility requirements, contact xxxx.
section3.paragraph2: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations’).
section3.paragraph3: If you’re not happy with how we respond to your complaint,
section3.linkText: contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS).

section4.header: Technical information about this service’s accessibility
section4.paragraph1: GDS is committed to making its website accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
section4.paragraph2: This service is compliant with the

section5.paragraph1: This statement was prepared on [date when it was first published]. It was last reviewed on [date when it was last reviewed].
section5.paragraph2: This service was last tested on [date] and was checked for compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA. The test was carried out by xxxxxx.
section5.linkText: read the full accessibility test report [add link to report].

resetPasswordAttemptBlocked.paragraph2: You can try again after 15 minutes have passed.

accountLocked.title: You entered the wrong password too many times
accountLocked.header: You entered the wrong password too many times
accountLocked.paragraph: You've been locked out of your account because you entered the wrong password more than 5 times. This is to keep your account secure.

bulletPointSection.title: You can:
bulletPointSection.first: wait 15 minutes and try to sign in again

section1.header: What do you need help with?

supportTypeRadios.govServiceRadioText: I work in a government service team and we want to start using GOV.UK Sign In
supportTypeRadios.publicRadioText: I’m a member of the public
supportTypeRadios.errorMessage: You must select an option to tell us what you need help with

section2.paragraph1: We can only respond to your support queries during office hours. Our office hours are 9:30am to 5:30pm, Monday to Friday.
section2.paragraph2: When you get in touch during office hours, we’ll try to reply within 2 working days.

contactUsGov.title: Contact Us
contactUsGov.paragraph1: You can find out how to:

paragraph2.text: Or if you still have questions, you can contact us at

section1.bulletPoint1: report any problems signing in to government services
section1.paragraph2: We only manage some government sign-ins, so we may need to send your email to another government department.
section1.questionsText: If your question or feedback is not about signing in, for example you want to ask about a tax or visa application, you need to different contact details

section2.paragraph1: Don’t include personal or financial information, for example your National Insurance number or credit card details.

question2.label: What would you like to tell us?
question2.hint: For example, if you had problem signing in describe what error message you saw

section3.header: If you'd like a reply, please provide your contact details
section3.paragraph1: We'll only use this to reply to your message.

contactUsSubmitSuccess.title: Your message has been submitted
contactUsSubmitSuccess.paragraph2: We’ll try to get back to you in 2 working days.
